entry.title: Combined summary - Seeking advice: Encouraging bug-fixing over new features
entry.summary: In this context, Gavin Andresen expresses his doubts regarding the effectiveness of awarding bounties for fixing bugs in Bitcoin's software. He believes that it may not encourage long-term contributors and may only result in quick fixes that do not address the underlying issues. He supports the idea of branching for releases and bug-fix-only-releases. He also mentions that he has arranged to get paid to work on Bitcoin full-time. In another email, Rick Wesson suggests offering a bounty or salary to find the right technical lead for the effort instead of offering bounties for fixing bugs. Another contributor suggests putting a bounty on the test framework to improve the software's functionality. Overall, the discussion revolves around finding effective ways to improve Bitcoin's software and incentivizing developers to contribute to the project.
